trans-unit.source: Provides methods for drawing and getting information about a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref>.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles?displayProperty=fullName> namespace exposes <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> objects that represent all of the controls and user interface (UI) elements that are supported by visual styles.
To draw or get information about a particular element, you must set a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> to the element you are interested in.

A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> is automatically set to a specified <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.%23ctor%2A> constructor, but you can also set an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> to a different element by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.SetParameters%2A> method.
To draw an element, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.DrawBackground%2A> method.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> class also includes methods, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.GetColor%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.GetEnumValue%2A>, that provide information about how an element is defined by the current visual style.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.%23ctor%2A> constructor and many of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> methods throw exceptions unless visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows.
To check for these conditions, use the `static`<xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> class wraps the functionality of the visual styles (UxTheme) API from the Windows Shell portion of the Windows Platform SDK.

For more information about visual styles, see "Using Windows XP Visual Styles" in the Platform SDK portion of the MSDN Library at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/).

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer"></xref> class using the given <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref>.

This constructor uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ClassName%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Part%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.State%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties of the `element` parameter to initialize the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Class%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Part%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.State%2A> properties.

Before using this constructor, you should call the `static`<xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.IsElementDefined%2A> method to verify whether the current visual style provides a definition for the element specified by the `element` parameter.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer"></xref> will represent.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
element is not defined by the current visual style.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer"></xref> class using the given class, part, and state values.

This constructor uses the `className`, `part`, and `state` parameters to initialize the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Class%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Part%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.State%2A> properties.

Before using this constructor, you should call the `static`<xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.IsElementDefined%2A> method to verify whether the current visual style provides a definition for the element specified by the `className`, `part`, and `state` parameters.
The class name of the element that this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer"></xref> will represent.
The part of the element that this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer"></xref> will represent.
The state of the element that this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer"></xref> will represent.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
The combination of className, part, and state is not defined by the current visual style.
Gets the class name of the current visual style element.
This property identifies a group of related controls or user interface (UI) elements.
For more information about the class, part, and state of a visual style element, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> class.
A string that identifies the class of the current visual style element.
Draws the background image of the current visual style element within the specified bounding rectangle.

This method draws the background of the current visual style element specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Class%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Part%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.State%2A> properties.

If the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Width%2A> or <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Height%2A> of the rectangle specified by the `bounds` parameter is less than 0, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.DrawBackground%2A> method will return without drawing the background.
The background of a visual style element can be a bitmap file or a filled border.

To determine the background type, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.GetEnumValue%2A> method with an argument value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.EnumProperty?displayProperty=fullName>.

To determine whether the element background will scale to fit the specified bounds, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.GetEnumValue%2A> method with an argument value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.EnumProperty?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> used to draw the background image.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which the background image is drawn.
dc is `null`.
Draws the background image of the current visual style element within the specified bounding rectangle and clipped to the specified clipping rectangle.

This method draws the background of the current visual style element specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Class%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Part%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.State%2A> properties.
The background will be clipped to the area specified by the `clipRectangle` parameter.

If the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Width%2A> or <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Height%2A> of the rectangle specified by either the `bounds` or `clipRectangle` parameters is less than 0, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.DrawBackground%2A> method will return without drawing the background.
The background of a visual style element can be a bitmap file or a filled border.

To determine the background type, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.GetEnumValue%2A> method with an argument value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.EnumProperty?displayProperty=fullName>.

To determine whether the element background will scale to fit the specified bounds, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.GetEnumValue%2A> method with an argument value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.EnumProperty?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> used to draw the background image.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which the background image is drawn.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that defines a clipping rectangle for the drawing operation.
dc is `null`.
Draws one or more edges of the specified bounding rectangle.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> used to draw the edges.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> whose bounds define the edges to draw.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.Edges"></xref> values.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.EdgeStyle"></xref> values.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.EdgeEffects"></xref> values.
A that represents the interior of the bounds parameter, minus the edges that were drawn.
dc is `null`.
Draws the specified image within the specified bounds.

If the visual style applies one of the effects specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.IconEffect?displayProperty=fullName> values to the current element, this method will apply the effect to the drawn image.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the image.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which the image is drawn.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to draw.
g or image is `null`.
Draws the image from the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref> within the specified bounds.

If the visual style applies one of the effects specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.IconEffect?displayProperty=fullName> values to the current element, this method will apply the effect to the drawn image.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the image.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which the image is drawn.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to draw.
The index of the within imageList to draw.
g or image is `null`.
imageIndex is less than 0, or greater than or equal to the number of images in imageList.
Draws the background of a control's parent in the specified area.
The used to draw the background of the parent of childControl.
This object typically belongs to the child control.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which to draw the parent control's background.
This rectangle should be inside the child control’s bounds.
The control whose parent's background will be drawn.
dc is `null`.
Draws text in the specified bounding rectangle with the option of displaying disabled text and applying other text formatting.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> used to draw the text.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which to draw the text.
The text to draw.
`true` to draw grayed-out text; otherwise, `false`.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values.
dc is `null`.
Draws text in the specified bounds using default formatting.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> used to draw the text.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which to draw the text.
The text to draw.
dc is `null`.
Draws text in the specified bounds with the option of displaying disabled text.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> used to draw the text.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which to draw the text.
The text to draw.
`true` to draw grayed-out text; otherwise, `false`.
dc is `null`.
Returns the content area for the background of the current visual style element.
A visual style can define a content area within each background image.
This is the area in which content such as text and icons can be placed without overwriting background borders.
This method uses the given background area to calculate the content area for the current visual style element.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> this operation will use.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the entire background area of the current visual style element.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the content area for the background of the current visual style element.
dc is `null`.
Returns the entire background area for the current visual style element.
A visual style can define a content area within each background image.
This is the area in which content such as text and icons can be placed without overwriting background borders.
This method uses the given content area to calculate the entire background area for the current visual style element.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> this operation will use.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the content area of the current visual style element.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the entire background area of the current visual style element.
dc is `null`.
Returns the region for the background of the current visual style element.
This method can be used to get the <xref:System.Drawing.Region> of a visual style element that has partially transparent or alpha-blended parts in its background.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> this operation will use.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the entire background area of the current visual style element.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Region"></xref> that contains the background of the current visual style element.
dc is `null`.
Returns the value of the specified Boolean property for the current visual style element.
Visual styles use a set of Boolean values to describe some properties of the elements defined by a style.
These properties are encapsulated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.BooleanProperty> values.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.BooleanProperty"></xref> values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.
`true` if the property specified by the prop parameter is `true` for the current visual style element; otherwise, `false`.
prop is not one of the values.
Returns the value of the specified color property for the current visual style element.
Visual styles use a set of color values to describe some properties of the elements defined by a style.
These properties are encapsulated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ColorProperty> values.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ColorProperty"></xref> values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.
A that contains the value of the property specified by the prop parameter for the current visual style element.
prop is not one of the values.
Returns the value of the specified enumerated type property for the current visual style element.
Visual styles use a set of enumerated types to describe some properties of the elements defined by a style.
These enumerated types are encapsulated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.EnumProperty> values.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.EnumProperty"></xref> values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.
The integer value of the property specified by the prop parameter for the current visual style element.
prop is not one of the values.
Returns the value of the specified file name property for the current visual style element.
Visual styles can specify the names of image files that are used to draw a particular element in different sizes and resolutions.
These file names are encapsulated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.FilenameProperty> values.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.FilenameProperty"></xref> values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.
A that contains the value of the property specified by the prop parameter for the current visual style element.
prop is not one of the values.
Returns the value of the specified font property for the current visual style element.
Visual styles use a set of font values to describe some properties of the elements defined by a style.
These properties are encapsulated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.FontProperty> values.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> this operation will use.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.FontProperty"></xref> values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.
A that contains the value of the property specified by the prop parameter for the current visual style element.
dc is `null`.
prop is not one of the values.
Returns the value of the specified integer property for the current visual style element.
Visual styles use a set of integer values to describe some properties of the elements defined by a style.
These properties are encapsulated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.IntegerProperty> values.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.IntegerProperty"></xref> values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.
The integer value of the property specified by the prop parameter for the current visual style element.
prop is not one of the values.
Returns the value of the specified margins property for the current visual style element.
Visual styles use a set of margin values to describe some properties of the elements defined by a style.
These properties are encapsulated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.MarginProperty> values.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> this operation will use.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.MarginProperty"></xref> values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.
A that contains the value of the property specified by the prop parameter for the current visual style element.
dc is `null`.
prop is not one of the values.
Returns the value of the specified size property of the current visual style part.

Typically, only the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ThemeSizeType.True> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ThemeSizeType.Minimum> values should be used for the `type` parameter of this method.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> this operation will use.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ThemeSizeType"></xref> values that specifies which size value to retrieve for the part.
A that contains the size specified by the type parameter for the current visual style part.
dc is `null`.
prop is not one of the values.
Returns the value of the specified size property of the current visual style part using the specified drawing bounds.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> this operation will use.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the area in which the part will be drawn.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ThemeSizeType"></xref> values that specifies which size value to retrieve for the part.
A that contains the size specified by the type parameter for the current visual style part.
dc is `null`.
prop is not one of the values.
Returns the value of the specified point property for the current visual style element.
Visual styles use a set of point values to describe some properties of the elements defined by a style.
These properties are encapsulated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.PointProperty> values.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.PointProperty"></xref> values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.
A that contains the value of the property specified by the prop parameter for the current visual style element.
prop is not one of the values.
Returns the value of the specified string property for the current visual style element.
Visual styles use a set of string values to describe some properties of the elements defined by a style.
These properties are encapsulated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.StringProperty> values.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.StringProperty"></xref> values that specifies which property value to retrieve for the current visual style element.
A that contains the value of the property specified by the prop parameter for the current visual style element.
prop is not one of the values.
Returns the size and location of the specified string when drawn with the font of the current visual style element.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> this operation will use.
The string to measure.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the area required to fit the rendered text.
dc is `null`.
Returns the size and location of the specified string when drawn with the font of the current visual style element within the specified initial bounding rectangle.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> this operation will use.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> used to control the flow and wrapping of the text.
The string to measure.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the area required to fit the rendered text.
dc is `null`.
Retrieves information about the font specified by the current visual style element.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> this operation will use.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.TextMetrics"></xref> that provides information about the font specified by the current visual style element.
dc is `null`.
Gets a unique identifier for the current class of visual style elements.
This property is used internally by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> methods.

If the class of elements specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Class%2A> property is not defined by the current visual style, then this property returns <xref:System.IntPtr.Zero?displayProperty=fullName>.
This property value is invalidated when the visual style of the operating system changes, or when the user disables visual styles.

If you access this property directly, your code should query this property again to get a new handle when the <xref:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.UserPreferenceChanged?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised with the <xref:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceChangedEventArgs.Category%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property value of <xref:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory?displayProperty=fullName>.
An <xref href="System.IntPtr"></xref> that identifies a set of data that defines the class of elements specified by <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Class"></xref>.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
Returns a hit test code indicating whether the point is contained in the background of the current visual style element and within the specified region.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> this operation will use.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the background of the current visual style element.
A Windows handle to a <xref href="System.Drawing.Region"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the hit test area within the background.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to test.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.HitTestOptions"></xref> values.
A that describes where pt is located in the background of the current visual style element.
dc is `null`.
Returns a hit test code indicating whether a point is contained in the background of the current visual style element.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.IDeviceContext"></xref> this operation will use.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the background of the current visual style element.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to test.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.HitTestOptions"></xref> values.
A that describes where pt is located in the background of the current visual style element.
dc is `null`.
Returns a hit test code indicating whether the point is contained in the background of the current visual style element and within the specified bounds.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> this operation will use.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the background of the current visual style element.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Region"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the hit test area within the background.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to test.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.HitTestOptions"></xref> values.
A that describes where pt is located in the background of the current visual style element, if at all.
g is `null`.
Indicates whether the background of the current visual style element has any semitransparent or alpha-blended pieces.
`true` if the background of the current visual style element has any semitransparent or alpha-blended pieces; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the specified visual style element is defined by the current visual style.
This method checks the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property internally.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> whose class and part combination will be verified.
`true` if the combination of the and properties of element are defined; otherwise, `false`.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
Gets a value specifying whether the operating system is using visual styles to draw controls.

The following table describes how to individually check for each of the three conditions that must exist for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property to return `true`.
Condition
How to determine separately
The operating system supports visual styles.
Verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleInformation.IsSupportedByOS%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleInformation> class is `true`.
The user has enabled visual styles in the operating system.
Verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleInformation.IsEnabledByUser%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleInformation> class is `true`.
Visual styles are being used to draw the client area of application windows.

Verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.VisualStyleState%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application> class has the value <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleState?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleState?displayProperty=fullName>.

`true` if the operating system supports visual styles, the user has enabled visual styles in the operating system, and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the last error code returned by the native visual styles (UxTheme) API methods encapsulated by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer"></xref> class.
This property gets the HRESULT value that was returned by the last native visual styles API method called by a member of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> class.

For more information about the native visual styles API, see "Using Windows XP Visual Styles" in the Platform SDK portion of the MSDN Library at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/).
A value specifying the last error code returned by the native visual styles API methods that this class encapsulates.
Gets the part of the current visual style element.
This property identifies a particular specialization of a class.
For more information about the class, part, and state of a visual style element, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> class.
A value that specifies the part of the current visual style element.
Sets this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer"></xref> to the visual style element represented by the specified class, part, and state values.
This method checks the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property internally.

Before calling this method, you should call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.IsElementDefined%2A> method to verify that the current visual style provides a definition for the element specified by the `className`, `part`, and `state` parameters.
The new value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Class"></xref> property.
The new value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Part"></xref> property.
The new value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.State"></xref> property.
The combination of className, part, and state is not defined by the current visual style.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.

Sets this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer"></xref> to the visual style element represented by the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref>.
This method checks the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property internally.

Before calling this method, you should call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.IsElementDefined%2A> method to verify that the current visual style provides a definition for the element specified by the `element` parameter.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that specifies the new values of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Class"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Part"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.State"></xref> properties.
element is not defined by the current visual style.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
Gets the state of the current visual style element.

This property identifies the current visual state of the element identified by the current <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Class%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer.Part%2A> property values.
For more information about the class, part, and state of a visual style element, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> class.
A value that identifies the state of the current visual style element.
